name: fish pastilla
ingredients: 500 g of fish fillet of your choice (cod, whiting, monkfish, etc.)
Chermoula spices: 2 tbsp of paprika, 2 tsp of cumin, salt and pepper
A few green olives, pitted and chopped into small pieces
steps: Prepare the chermoula: Chop the herbs (parsley and coriander) and mix them with the garlic cloves, spices, olive oil, lemon juice, and soy sauce.
Wash the fish, peel the shrimp, cut the fish fillets into cubes. Marinate the fish and seafood in the chermoula.
Briefly sauté the fish and seafood (shrimp and squid) to cook them. Reserve the cooking juice.
Soak the black mushrooms and rice vermicelli, drain and chop them. Sauté them in the fish cooking juice with the tomato paste and olives.
Mix the fish, seafood, vermicelli, and the mushroom/olive preparation. Let cool.
Assembly: Butter a mold. Place the brick/pastilla sheets, leaving the edges overhanging. Fill with the stuffing. Fold the edges. Cover with a final sheet.
Generously brush with melted butter and egg yolk.
Bake in the oven at 180 °C for 40 minutes or until the pastilla is golden. Decorate and serve hot.
